abstract: Biogen Idec acknowledged Thursday afternoon that a candidate nominated by Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, had won a seat on the drug maker’s board after a contentious proxy fight, but it said the vote was still too close to call on whether Mr. Icahn won a second seat.
snippet: Biogen Idec acknowledged Thursday afternoon that a candidate nominated by Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, had won a seat on the drug maker’s board after a contentious proxy fight, but it said the vote was still too close to call ...
lead_paragraph: Biogen Idec acknowledged Thursday afternoon that a candidate nominated by Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, had won a seat on the drug maker’s board after a contentious proxy fight, but it said the vote was still too close to call on whether Mr. Icahn won a second seat.

headline.main: Biogen Confirms Icahn Won at Least One Board Seat
